meanings.definition: To remove the bale from something.
meanings.sent1: Please unbale the hay before feeding the horses.
meanings.sent2: Farmers unbale the cotton before sending it to the textile factory.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy worker accidentally unbale the shipment, causing a mess.
meanings.sent4: She had to unbale her emotions before she could move on.
meanings.sent5: The magician seemed to unbale a rabbit out of the hat.

meanings.definition: Not baled; not bundled or packaged in bales.
meanings.sent1: The unbale hay scattered all over the field.
meanings.sent2: The unbale goods were difficult to transport.
meanings.sent3: The unbale package looked like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like unbale threads, tangled and messy.
meanings.sent5: The unbale books were stacked haphazardly on the shelf.
